page.title: 16CONSERVATION AT MIDWAY MANOR
page.content: The owner of {Midway Manor}is now the{ {Cairman of the World Wildlife Fund. } He moved there in 1972 and started keeping rare breeds of sheep like the{ {Wiltshire Horn},then 2 llamas ,2 emus and a pair of zebra. He has liked animals since he was a child. Now he and his staff have about 102 rare or exotic birds and animals many are endangered species. Sometimes he helps other zoos by lending animals for breeding. He wants to educate people more about endangered species. A century ago there were only 14{ {Przewalsky horses}alive ,now there are 400. The ones we saw had pet names. There are tapirs, llamas, pigmy goats, {Grevy zebra},cranes, rheas, alpacas, Jacobs sheep, snowy owls, long eared owls, white owls,wallabies. Prettiest of all were the{Chinese water bucks}.
